documentContentReferences.name: SoA and Screening Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the amendment summary to Table 1, noting the addition of a footnote about screening procedures detailed in Section 8.

documentContentReferences.name: Screening Site Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the amendment summary to Section 8 for details on procedures specific to screening-only sites in the US.

documentContentReferences.name: COVID-19 Vaccine Risk Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 10.5 for potential risks and mitigation measures related to the COVID-19 vaccine.

documentContentReferences.name: Investigator's Brochure Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to the Investigator's Brochure (IB) for data on ALXN1840 and ammonium tetrathiomolybdate.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Reference from Risk Table
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 3 to Section 6.6 for dose modification or discontinuation strategies.

documentContentReferences.name: Adaptive Features Table Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Table 4 for a description of adaptive design features and their limits.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Criteria Table Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: ALXN1840 Dose Modifications for Individual Participants
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 4 to Table 7, which outlines criteria for dose modification.

documentContentReferences.name: Screening Exclusion Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from lifestyle considerations to Section 5.2 regarding exclusion due to blood donation.

documentContentReferences.name: Contraceptive Methods Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Contraceptive Guidance and Collection of Pregnancy Information
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 10.4 for descriptions of appropriate contraceptive methods.

documentContentReferences.name: Contraceptive Start Time Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 5.1 for information on start times for contraceptive use.

documentContentReferences.name: Discontinuation Data Collection Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to the SoA for data to be collected at the time of study intervention discontinuation.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification for Liver Function Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to dose modification criteria in Section 6.6 for participants with abnormal liver function.

documentContentReferences.name: Pregnancy Discontinuation Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 8.2.6 regarding discontinuation due to pregnancy.

documentContentReferences.name: Discontinuation Samples Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to the SoA (Table 1) for samples and data to be collected at the time of study intervention discontinuation.

documentContentReferences.name: ECG Schedule Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to the SoA for the schedule of 12-lead ECGs.

documentContentReferences.name: QTc Withdrawal Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: DISCONTINUATION OF STUDY INTERVENTION AND PARTICIPANT DISCONTINUATION/WITHDRAWAL
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 7 for QTc withdrawal criteria.

documentContentReferences.name: Clinical Lab Tests Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 10.2 for the list of clinical laboratory tests and to the SoA (Section 1.3) for timing.

documentContentReferences.name: AE/SAE Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Adverse Events: Definitions and Procedures for Recording, Evaluating, Follow-up, and Reporting
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 10.3 for procedures on recording, evaluating, and reporting AEs and SAEs.

documentContentReferences.name: Lost to Follow-up Definition Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 7.3 for the definition of lost to follow-up.

documentContentReferences.name: Genetic Testing Non-use Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 8.7 to clarify that biobanked samples will not be used for genetic testing.

documentContentReferences.name: PK Sample Collection Schedule Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to the SoA (Table 1) for the schedule of whole blood sample collection for PK analysis.

documentContentReferences.name: Molybdenum Measurement Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 8.1.1 for details on molybdenum measurement in food, drinks, urine, and feces.

documentContentReferences.name: Biomarker Details Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 8.6 for details on biomarker measurements like total copper and ceruloplasmin.

documentContentReferences.name: Analysis Populations Table Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Table 8 for definitions of the population sets used for analyses.

commentAnnotations.text: To align the number of days with the mention of zinc discontinuation elsewhere in the protocol.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: PROTOCOL AMENDMENT SUMMARY OF CHANGES TABLE

commentAnnotations.text: To facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: PROTOCOL AMENDMENT SUMMARY OF CHANGES TABLE

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: ALT = alanine aminotransferase; AST = aspartate aminotransferase; IB = Investigator’s Brochure; PK = pharmacokinetics; WD = Wilson disease.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Table 3: Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: CRF = case report form; CRU = clinical research unit; EOS = End of Study; SoA = Schedule of Activities.
Abbreviations: ICF = informed consent form; PD = pharmacodynamic; PK = pharmacokinetic.

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Protocol Amendment 3.1 specific to the US to clarify study procedures and facilitate recruitment.
